name: end
description: Keyword "end" used in command syntax patterns.
syntax_examples:
<script type="text/hyperscript">
  def throwsIfTrue(value)
    if value throw "Yep!"
  end
</script>

tell <expression>
  <statements>
end

<script type="text/hyperscript">
  -- return the answer
  def theAnswer()
    return 42
  end
</script>

async <command>

async do
 {command}
end

<script type="text/hyperscript">
  def increment(i, j)
    return (i as int) + (j as int)
  end
</script>

worker Incrementer
  js
    function _increment(n) { return n + 1 }
  end
  def increment(n) return _increment(n) end
end

<script type="text/hyperscript">
  worker Miner("/scripts/mine-crypto.js")
  	js
  		var miner = new CryptoMiner();
  		return { miner }
  	end

  	def startMining() miner.start() end
  	def stopMining() miner.stop() end
  end
</script>

<label>
  <input
    type="checkbox"
    _="on change
                            if me.checked Miner.startMining()
                            else Miner.stopMining()"
  />
  Disable ads <small>and enable cryptocurrency mining</small>
</label>

def <function name>(<parameter list>)
  {<command>}
[catch <identifier>
  {<command>}]
[finally
  {<command>}]
end

<script type="text/hyperscript">
  def delayTheAnswer()
    wait 2s
    return 42
  end
</script>

<script type="text/hyperscript">
  def utils.delayTheAnswer()
    wait 2s
    return 42
  end
</script>

<script type="text/hyperscript">
  def delayTheAnswer()
    wait 2s
    throw "Nope!"
  catch e
    return e
  end
</script>

name: from
description: Keyword "from" used in command syntax patterns.
usage_context:
k items 2 to 4 from arr
--      it
pick items from start to 4 fro
syntax_examples:
make (a|an) <expression> [from <arg-list>] [called <identifier>]
make (a|an) <query-ref>                    [called <identifier>]
make a URL from "/path/", "https://origin.example.com"

set arr to [10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15]
pick items 2 to 4 from arr
--      it = [12, 13]
pick items 2 to 4 from arr inclusive
--      it = [12, 13, 14]
pick items 2 to 4 from arr exclusive
--      it = [13]

pick items from start to 4 from arr
--      it = [10, 11, 12, 13]
pick items from 2 to end from arr
--      it = [12, 13, 14, 15]
pick items from start to end from arr
--      it = [10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15]

set str to "The quick brown fox jumps over the lazy dog."
pick match of "the (\w+)" from str
log it[0] -- "the lazy"
log it[1] -- "lazy"
pick match of "the (\w+)" | i from str
log it[0] -- "The quick"
log it[1] -- "quick"

name: in
description: Keyword "in" used in command syntax patterns.
usage_context: th 20px of padding in the viewpo
peat for match in result index i

eat for person in people
    app

ul)
	for item in array
		-- put
syntax_examples:
def formatPizzaToppings(toppings)
  make an Intl.ListFormat from "en", { type: "conjunction" }
    called listFmt

  for part in listFmt.formatToParts(toppings)
    if the part's type is "element"
      make a <span.topping/>
      put the part's value into its textContent
      append it to #toppings
    else
      append the part's value to #toppings
    end
  end

           js

               	 return navigator.clipboard.readText()
               }
           end
           put it in my.innerHTML "

<button
  _="on click
           set text to #input.value
           js(me, text)
               if ('clipboard' in window.navigator) {
               	 return navigator.clipboard.writeText(text)
               	   .then(() => 'Copied')
               	   .catch(() => me.parentElement.remove(me))
               }
           end
           put message in my.innerHTML "
></button>

name: on
description: Keyword "on" used in command syntax patterns.
usage_context: erate while a condition is true
nd to the else on the previous l
syntax_examples:
-- the basic for loop
  repeat for p in <p/>
    add .example to p
  end

  -- syntactic sugar for the above
  for p in <p/>
    add .example to p
  end

  -- iterating over an array but without an explicit variable
  -- instead the keyword it is used
  repeat in <p/>
    add .example to it
  end

  -- iterate while a condition is true
  repeat while #div matches .active
    put "Still waiting." into #div.innerHTML
    wait 1s
    put "Still waiting.." into #div.innerHTML
    wait 1s
    put "Still waiting..." into #div.innerHTML
  end

  -- iterate until a condition is true
  repeat until #div does not match .active
    put "Still waiting." into #div.innerHTML
    wait 1s
    put "Still waiting.." into #div.innerHTML
    wait 1s
    put "Still waiting..." into #div.innerHTML
  end

  -- iterate until an event 'stop' occurs
  repeat until event stop
    put "Still waiting." into #div.innerHTML
    wait 1s
    put "Still waiting.." into #div.innerHTML
    wait 1s
    put "Still waiting..." into #div.innerHTML
  end

  -- iterate five times
  repeat 5 times
    put "Fun " before end of #div.innerHTML
  end

  -- iterate forever
  repeat forever
    toggle .throb on #div
    wait 1s
  end

...
else
  if false   -- does not bind to the else on the previous line as an "else if"
    log 'foo'
  end
  log 'bar'
end
<method name>(<arg list>) [(to | on | with | into | from | at)] <expression>

socket <socket-name> <socket-url> [with timeout <time expr>]
    [on message [as json] <command-list>]

socket MySocket ws://myserver.com/example
  on message as json
    log message
end

eventsource ChatUpdates from http://myserver.com/chat-updates

  on newMessage as json
    log it
  end

  on updateMessage as json
    log it
  end

end

eventsource demo from http://server/demo

    on message as string
        put it into #div
    end

    on open
        log "connection opened."
    end

    on close
        log "connection closed."
    end

    on error
        log "handle error here..."
    end

end

-- define the SSE EventSource
eventsource UpdateServer from http://server/updates
    on message
        log it
    end
end

-- elsewhere in your code, listen for the "cancelGoAway" message, then disconnect
on cancelGoAway from UpdateServer
    log "received cancel message from server"
    call UpdateServer.close()
end

eventsource DynamicServer
    on message as json
        log it
    end
end

-- somewhere else in your code
DynamicServer.open("test.com/test1.sse") -- creates a new connection to this URL

DynamicServer.open("test.com/test2.sse") -- automatically closes the first connection
DynamicServer.close()

DynamicServer.open("test.com/test3.sse") -- reconnects to a different endpoint.

Click to get rid of me

<script type="text/hyperscript">
  behavior Removable
    on click
      remove me
    end
  end
</script>

<script type="text/hyperscript">
  behavior Removable(removeButton)
    on click from removeButton
        remove me
    end
  end
</script>

<script type="text/hyperscript">
  behavior Removable(removeButton)
    init
      if no removeButton set the removeButton to me
    end

    on click from removeButton
      remove me
    end
  end
</script>
